main event: A circular object with a plastic dome protruding from the top, about 23 feet in diameter, and having a very bright light which lit up the observer's back yard was sighted in Juniata, Pennsylvania on August 27, 1956.
interesting points: The object gained an estimated 20,000 feet in altitude and headed north at a high rate of speed.
The object was visually sighted for three minutes and disappeared by fading out of sight.
The report lists the object as 'Probably Balloon, Probably Solid, Probably Astronomical, Unidentified'.
sighted object: circular object with a plastic dome and a very bright light
